categories.name: Retail
categories.definition: The CBDC is available to the general public for all transactions

categories.name: Wholesale
categories.definition: The CBDC is used by financial institutions for bank-to-bank transactions and settlements

categories.name: Direct CBDC
categories.definition: The CBDC is a direct claim on the central bank, which handles consumersâ€™ retail payments and records all transactions, unlike cash.

categories.name: Hybrid CBDCC
categories.definition: This is an intermediate solution where the CBDC is a direct claim on the central bank but payments and real-time transactions are facilitated by financial intermediaries including commercial banks.

categories.name: Synthetic CBDCC
categories.definition: The CBDC is not a direct claim on the central bank; Claims are a liability of private financial institutions that facilitate payments and real-time transactions.

access.name: Access
access.title: An account-based system or digital tokens are two ways users can access a CBDC and execute payments. The classic example of a token-based system is cash, and an example of an account-based system is bank deposits. Accounts are linked to identity.

infrastructure.name: Infrastructure
infrastructure.title: The infrastructure could be based on a conventional centrally controlled database or on  distributed ledger technology (DLT). Conventional and DLT-based infrastructures often store data multiple times and in physically separate locations. The main difference between them lies in how the transactions are verified and secured.

categories.name: Research
categories.definition: Established working groups to explore the use cases, impact, and feasibility of a CBDC

categories.name: Development
categories.definition: Initiated technical build and early testing of a CBDC in controlled environments

categories.name: Pilot
categories.definition: Initiated small-scale testing of a CBDC in the real world with a limited number of participants

categories.name: Launched
categories.definition: Issued a CBDC for widespread retail and/or wholesale use

categories.name: Other
categories.definition: No formal CBDC research but ongoing development of digital wallets and new payments infrastructure
